lines.content: Duke is a desktop app for **managing tasks**, and it is optimized for use via a **Command Line
while still having the benefits of a **Graphical User Interface (GUI)**.
Duke's GUI is in the form of a chatbot.
User guide for Duke chatbot is available
To get a local copy up and running follow these simple steps.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/Main.java` file, right-click it, and
choose `Run Main.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see a GUI appear.
Contributions are what make the open source community such an amazing place to be learn, inspire,
and create. Any contributions you make are **greatly appreciated**.
2. Create your Feature Branch (`git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature`)
3. Commit your Changes (`git commit -m 'Add some AmazingFeature'`)
4. Push to the Branch (`git push origin feature/AmazingFeature`)

Duke is a desktop app for **managing tasks**, and it is optimized for use via a **Command Line
while still having the benefits of a **Graphical User Interface (GUI)**.
Duke's GUI is in the form of a chatbot.
1. Ensure that you have Java 11 or above installed in your computer
Adds a new deadline task to the task list.
Deletes a specified task from the task list.
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list
- The index **must be a positive integer** (e.g. 1, 2, 3, ...)
Deletes the second item in the task list
Deletes the tenth item in the task list
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- The index **must be a positive integer** (e.g. 1, 2, 3, ...)
Marks the first item in the task list as completed
Marks the tenth item in the task list as completed
Adds a new event task to the task list.
Finds task where description contains keyword.
- The search is case-insensitive (e.g. hans will match Hans)
- Only the task description is searched, not the date
- Partial words will match full words (e.g. han will match hans)
Will return tasks which has the keyword `2103` in the description (e.g. CS2103, cs2103, 2103
Will return tasks which has the keyword `make` in the description (e.g. maker, make cake,
Displays the help message which contains all the information on each command available.
Lists out all the tasks in the task list.
Adds a new todo task to the task list.
### Where is the save data stored?
The save data for Duke is stored under the user's home folder.

+ "Time formats available: 24 Hour Format [HH:mm][HHmm] or 12 Hour Format [hh:mm am/pm][hhmm am/pm]";

+ "\nNow you have %d tasks in the list.";

* DukeDateTimeParserException class represents an invalid date format in Duke application.

* Deadline is a type of Task that needs to be done before a specific date/time.
* Indicates the end date/time of the deadline.
* Event is a type of Task that includes a time.
* Indicates the time of the event.
* Searchable interface represents an item that can be searched.
